data.title: Today in History Africa 28 February
data.meta_description: Many things happened today in history in Africa 28 February. Read this post to learn about these interesting African historical events.
data.text:
Want to know what happened Today in History Africa: 28 February? These are 4 historical events that took place today, in the continent of Africa and the African diaspora.

The continent of Africa has an immensely rich history; hidden African history is becoming more accessible as it is finally coming to light. African history, people, culture and books have influenced and inspired the world for time immemorial; it is now time for Africa to shine!

In this post you will learn about the many things that happened today in history in Africa and in the African diaspora like what caused to the 1948 Accra Riots.

After reading this post you will know tons of facts about Africa in relation to: the Egyptian independence, the 1948 Accra Riots, Sergeant Cornelius Francis Adjetey and Philip Emeagwali.

This post is all about what happened Today in History Africa 28 February.

Today in History Africa: 28 February

African Holidays

Independence Day in Egypt

Today, 28 February 2023, is Independence Day in Egypt. It is a public holiday. It is celebrated every year on 28 February throughout the country.

عيد استقلال مصر سعيد!

African Historical Events

The First Martyrs for Independence in Ghana

On this day, 28 February 1948, the unarmed Sergeant Cornelius Francis Adjetey and his comrades were shot dead by Britain’s colonial government for petitioning for the rights of Africans in the Gold Coast colony in present-day Ghana.

The murder of World War II veterans Sgt. Cornelius Francis Adjetey, Corporal Patrick Attipoe and Private Odartey Lamptey was in many was “the straw that broke the camel’s back” in the struggle for Ghanian independence. It lead to the 1948 Accra Riots and to the eventual independence of Ghana – nearly 10 years later – on 6 March 1957.

Today Adjetey, Attipoe and Lamptey are recognized as the first martyrs in the fight for independence from British colonialism in Ghana.

Independence of Egypt

On this day, 28 February 1922, Egypt gained its independence from Britain.

African Achievement

Philip Emeagwali awarded the Gordon Bell Prize

On this day, 28 February 1990, Philip Emeagwali was awarded the Gordon Bell Prize for solving one of the twenty most difficult problems in supercomputing.

This post was all about what happened today in history Africa 28 February.
